{
  "Allegations" : "CUSTOMER ALLEGES THAT IN 2006 AND 2007 THE REPRESENTATIVE BORROWED A TOTAL OF $545,000 AND HAS NOT REPAID AS AGREED. CUSTOMER REQUESTS RETURN OF PRINCIPAL, INTEREST AND LATE FEES. THESE LOANS WERE ACTIVELY CONCEALED FROM THE FIRM.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$545,000.00",

  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : ""
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CUSTOMERS PURCHASED A VARIABLE ANNUITY IN SEPTEMBER 2007. IN OCTOBER 2007, CUSTOMERS REFINANCED THEIR HOME AND USED THE PROCEEDS TO INVEST IN THE VARIABLE ANNUITY.  CUSTOMERS ALLEGE EACH OF THESE INVESTMENTS WERE AT THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE REP AND THAT THEY WERE NOT SUITABLE.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$228,030.48",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$55,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "Y",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "10-00345",
  "Broker Comment" : "IN ORDER TO RESOLVE THE MATTER AND AVOID THE EXPENSE AND UNCERTAINTIES OF FURTHER DISCUSSION, AN AMICABLE, CONFIDENTIAL SETTLEMENT WAS REACHED WITH THE CLAIMANTS ON 3-16-2011. SIMULTANEOUSLY, THE ACTION WAS DISMISSED WITH PREJUDICE ON THE SAME DATE."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CUSTOMER CLAIMS REP SOLD AN ANNUITY PRODUCT IN A CHARITABLE REMAINDER TRUST WITH GUARANTEED INCOME REPLACEMENT OF APPROXIMATELY $1200 PER MONTH WITH TAX BENEFITS. AS THE MARKET VALUE OF THE ANNUITY INVESTMENT FLUCTUATES, AND THE ASSET IS ANNUALLY RE-EVALUATED, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TRUST DISTRIBUTION PROVISIONS, THE INCOME EARNED IN 2009 WAS LESS THAN $1200 PER MONTH.  CUSTOMER REQUESTS REIMBURSEMENT OF ANY INCOME DIFFERENCE.",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "AFTER FULL REVEIW OF THE CLAIM, VALMARK SECURITES FINDS THE CLAIM UNJUSTIFIED, WITHOUT MERIT AND HAS NOTIFIED THE CUSTOMERS OF THE DENIAL."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENTS ALLEGE THAT RICHARD SULLENGER SOLD THE [CUSTOMERS] THREE UNSUITABLE VARIABLE ANNUITIES SOMETIME AFTER 2000 THAT THE SUB ACCOUNTS WITH IN THE VARIABLE ANNUITIES WERE ALSO INVESTED UNSUITABLY IN SPECULATIVE AND AGGRESSIVE EQUITIES.  CLIENTS ALSO ALLEGE A BREACH OF CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE, BREACH OF FIDUCIARY DUTY, CONSTRUCTIVE FRAUD, FAILURE TO SUPERVISE AND CONTROL, VIOLATIONS OF STATE AND FEDERAL SECURITIES LAWS, THE NASD AND NYSE RULES, THE CALIFORNIA ELDER ABUSE STATUE, AND THE CALIFORNIA UNFAIR OR DECEPTIVE PRACTICES AGAINST SENIOR CITIZENS STATUTE.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$1,000,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$300,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE  [CUSTOMERS] PURCHASED THE VARIABLE ANNUITIES BEFORE THE 2001-2002 DOWNTURN IN THE MARKET.  AFTER THE SIGNIFICANT DOWN MARKET THE [CUSTOMERS] PERSONALLY REALLOCATED THEIR ANNUITY SUB ACCOUNTS TO MONEY MARKET AND SIMILAR LOW-RISK, LOW RETURN ASSETS.  THIS ACTION CAUSED THE ANNUITY TO PERFORM LESS THAN IF THE [CUSTOMERS] HAD STAYED THE ORIGINAL INVESTMENT COURSE, AS SUGGESTED BY THE REPRESNETATIVE.  THE SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT CALLS FOR EFFECTUATING AN EXPUNGEMENT OF THE MATTER FROM THE REPRESENTATIVE'S RECORDS."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT ALLEGES AN ERROR IN FILLING OUT THE VARIABLE ANNUITY APPLICATION RESULTED IN THE LIVING BENEFIT RIDER NOT BEING ATTACHED TO THE CONTRACT AND THAT THE ANNUITY WAS NOT FULLY DESCRIBED AT THE TIME OF SOLICITATION.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$733,860.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$510,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "IN FILLING OUT THE VARIABLE ANNUITY APPLICATION, AN OMISSION ERROR WAS MADE BY NOT ADDING A WRITTEN STATEMENT REQUESTING THAT THE LIVING BENEFIT RIDER BE ATTACHED TO THE CONTRACT.  WHEN THE CUSTOMER BROUGHT THE ERROR TO THE REPRESENTATIVE'S ATTENTION, THE REPRESENTATIVE IMMEDIATELY AGREED THAT HE HAD ERRED IN THIS REGARD AND HE BEGAN THE PROCESS TO MAKE THE CLIENT WHOLE.  THE ANNUITY, FURTHERMORE, WAS FULLY DESCRIBED IN THE MATERIALS PROVIDED TO THE CLIENT, INCLUDING THE PROSPECTUS AND THE CONTRACT ITSELF."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENTS ALLEGE PURCHASE OF VARIABLE ANNUITY WAS MISREPRESENTED AND UNSUITABLE",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$43,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE VEHEMENTLY DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS.  THE REP CONDUCTED APPROPRIATE DUE DILIGENCE INTERVIEWS WITH THE CLIENTS IN WHICH THEIR RISK TOLERANCE AND INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES WERE DISCLOSED.  THE CLIENTS WERE ALSO PROVIDED WITH PROSPECTUSES, CONTRACTS, OTHER WRITTEN MATERIALS, AND SEVERAL ORAL DISCUSSIONS, ALL OF WHICH ACCURATELY DESCRIBED THE PRODUCT IN DETAIL WITH NO MISREPRESENTATIONS.  AFTER SUCH DISCLOSURES WERE MADE, THE CLIENTS AGREED TO PURCHASE THE PRODUCT RECOGNIZING THE RISKS OF MARKET FLUCTUATIONS."
}
